channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Spain to host 2030 World Cup final, federation says
item.description: Spain "will be the leader of the 2030 World Cup and the final of that World Cup will be held here" says the president of the country's football federation.

item.title: Man Utd's Dorgu set for weeks out with hamstring issue
item.description: In-form Patrick Dorgu is still being assessed but he is likely to miss Manchester United matches with the injury he picked up against Arsenal.

item.title: Bournemouth sign Brazilian teenager Rayan for £24.7m
item.description: Bournemouth sign striker Rayan, a striker of "enormous potential" from Vasco da Gama after completing a loan move for Lazio goalkeeper Christos Mandas.

item.title: How 'Premier League' Galatasaray can derail Man City
item.description: Needing a positive result to keep their Champions League campaign on track, Galatasaray are not the side Manchester City would choose to face in their final game of the league phase.

item.title: Luiz agrees Villa return on loan
item.description: Aston Villa agree a deal to re-sign former midfielder Douglas Luiz on loan as Unai Emery looks to bolster his options in the centre of the pitch.

item.title: Bayern Munich open talks to extend Kane contract
item.description: Bayern Munich sporting director Max Eberl says the German club are in talks with Harry Kane about extending the striker's contract.

item.title: Barca president unhappy at teen's 'unpleasant' PSG move
item.description: PSG sign 18-year-old Barcelona midfielder Dro Fernandez, with the Spanish side's president calling the situation around the transfer "unpleasant".

item.title: Blame me for Leicester's woes - owner Khun Top
item.description: Leicester owner Khun Aiyawatt 'Top' Srivaddhanaprabha takes the blame for the club's decline from Premier League title winners to a mid-table Championship side.

item.title: 'It's a dream' - champions of Africa facing Arsenal
item.description: Moroccan champions AS FAR have been building towards their moment in Fifa's Champions Cup against Arsenal on Wednesday.

item.title: Three EFL games postponed because of Storm Chandra
item.description: Port Vale against AFC Wimbledon in League One and games at Barrow and Cheltenham in League Two are postponed because of Storm Chandra.

item.title: Brighton women's coach Rado Vidosic dies aged 64
item.description: Rado Vidosic, Brighton's women's and girls' head of coaching and father of women's head coach Dario, dies aged 64.

item.title: Barry goal rescues draw for Everton against Leeds
item.description: Watch Premier League highlights as Everton's Thierno Barry continues his good run of form with a second-half goal to earn the Toffees a 1-1 draw with Leeds United.

item.title: Palace could get dragged into this - Sutton
item.description: Chris Sutton tells the Monday Night Club that he believes Crystal Palace could be dragged into a relegation battle in the Premier League if they don't make a decision on manager Oliver Glasner soon.

item.title: Moyes praises Everton's 'much better' second half
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes praises a "much better" second-half display that saw French forward Thierno Barry equalise to give the Toffees a 1-1 Premier League draw with Leeds at the Hill Dickinson stadium.

item.title: Leeds have good momentum right now - Farke
item.description: Leeds United manager Daniel Farke believes his side's 1-1 draw at Everton is another "good result" and another example of their improved form, having lost only once in the past 11 matches.

item.title: Carrick needs to be judged over a longer period - Sutton
item.description: Mark Chapman is joined by Chris Sutton on The Monday Night Club as the former Premier League striker praises Michael Carrick after his "brilliant start" as interim head coach of Manchester United.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: Why do Premier League teams spend less in January?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why clubs spend significantly more on new signings in the summer than they do in the January transfer window.

item.title: Injuries, Everton & overseas friendly - Scotland's World Cup preparations
item.description: BBC Scotland looks at the national team's warm-up schedule, Steve Clarke's injury concerns, and what sort of shape his side's opponents are in.

item.title: One week until transfer deadline day - who could be on the move?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at some of the players that have been linked with moves before the Premier League transfer deadline on 2 February at 19:00 GMT.

item.title: Forest make £35m Mateta bid - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: Nottingham Forest make a £35m bid for Crystal Palace's Jean-Philippe Mateta, Juventus consider move for Everton's Beto, Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes will decide on his future at the end of the season, plus more.

item.title: Games at Arbroath, St Johnstone & Stranraer off
item.description: Arbroath's Challenge Cup tie with Airdrie, Ayr's quarter-final visit to St Johnstone and Stranraer v Clyde in League 2 are postponed.

item.title: Besiktas pay £11m for Abraham - to sell him to Villa
item.description: Besiktas pay £11.2m to Roma for Tammy Abraham - as the Turkish club prepare to sell him to Aston Villa.

item.title: Yorath remembered at funeral as 'funny, humble man'
item.description: About 100 mourners attended the funeral of the Wales and Leeds midfielder, who died aged 75.

item.title: What history tells us about Arsenal's title chances
item.description: With Arsenal still four points clear despite a wobble, how confident can they be of winning the title based on Premier League precedent?

item.title: Bove 'not scared' to return at Watford after cardiac arrest
item.description: Italian midfielder Edoardo Bove says he is "not scared" of making a return to football with Watford.

item.title: Martinez edging closer to Villa career crossroads
item.description: Emiliano Martinez is hailed as the world's best goalkeeper at Aston Villa home games - but even though his team are riding high, the Argentina international is at a crossroads.

item.title: 'Heading football likely to have contributed to McQueen's brain disease'
item.description: An inquest concludes that "it is likely that repetitive head impacts, sustained by heading the ball while playing football, contributed to the CTE" which was a factor in the former Scotland footballer's death.

item.title: 'It's unfathomable' - Dyche wants towels banned for throw-ins
item.description: Nottingham Forest boss Sean Dyche wants the Premier League to ban towels from the sidelines after complaining about the time taken for throw-ins during his side's win at Brentford.

item.title: Ipswich sign Sunderland midfielder Neil on loan
item.description: Ipswich Town sign midfielder Dan Neil from Sunderland on loan until the end of the season, when he will leave the Black Cats.

item.title: 'Determined' McGregor dismisses Saudi links
item.description: Celtic captain Callum McGregor dismisses speculation linking him with a move away from his boyhood club and says he is more determined than ever to take them back to the top in Scotland.

item.title: Fulham close to agreement for Man City winger Bobb
item.description: Fulham are close to reaching an agreement to sign winger Oscar Bobb from fellow Premier League side Manchester City.

item.title: Was Chelsea's penalty at Crystal Palace a VAR error?
item.description: Jaydee Canvot blocked Joao Pedro's goal-bound shot with his arm and a penalty was awarded after a VAR intervention - but was it the right decision?

item.title: How Wrexham plan to benefit from £48m cash boost
item.description: Share documents have revealed Wrexham have benefited from almost £50m in new investment from an American finance group.

item.title: Pato consortium interested in Colchester takeover
item.description: Former AC Milan and Brazil forward Alexandre Pato is a member of a consortium interested in taking over Colchester United.

item.title: Plymouth boss Cleverley handed third ban of season
item.description: Plymouth Argyle head coach Tom Cleverley receives a third touchline ban of the season after admitting to an FA charge of misconduct.

item.title: 'Intoxicating title fight impossible to call as Hearts refuse to buckle'
item.description: Depleted Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts passed the latest test of their mettle in compelling draw with Celtic, writes Tom English.

item.title: Liverpool's Robertson unlikely to move to Spurs
item.description: Liverpool left-back Andy Robertson looks set to remain at Anfield after the Reds decide they are currently unable to proceed with a deal to sell him to Tottenham.

item.title: Fulham make £28m bid to sign PSV forward Pepi
item.description: Fulham make a £28m bid to sign United States forward Ricardo Pepi from Dutch club PSV Eindhoven.

item.title: Why Arsenal's wobble may not even matter - despite 'feeling pressure'
item.description: Arsenal's winless run may normally be cause for concern - but the stats suggest they are still in control of the Premier League title race.

item.title: Football club DNA quiz: Which team is being described?
item.description: You'll see five real quotes depicting a team's DNA, way or philosophy. Can you guess the club each quote describes?

item.title: 'Another unbelievable result' - but what's different about Man Utd now?
item.description: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains how Manchester United earned their impressive win at Premier League leaders Arsenal, and how he feels the Gunners will react.

item.title: Hardly anyone would have picked Carrick to be Man Utd boss - but now?
item.description: As Michael Carrick's perfect start at Manchester United continues, is he building a case for the job longer term?

item.title: 'Saipan was not a jolly' - the infamous Keane v McCarthy row
item.description: Former Republic of Ireland keeper Dean Kiely reveals what happened during Roy Keane and Mick McCarthy's infamous row before the 2002 World Cup.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Which countries haven't had a Premier League player?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which countries have not been represented in the Premier League.

item.title: Which countries are set to win extra Champions League places?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains which countries are on course to win extra qualification spots for the 2026-27 Champions League campaign.

item.title: Can January signings play in the Champions League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Antoine Semenyo and Conor Gallagher won't yet be able to play for their new clubs in the Champions League.

item.title: How much has Guardiola spent on defenders at Man City?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how many defenders Manchester City have signed since Pep Guardiola arrived at the Etihad.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who will Arsenal play?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Rangers bid for Hansa Rostock striker Naderi - gossip
item.description: Rangers bid for striker as Dutch club are linked with Ibrox forward and Scottish names are mentioned in connection with Leicester City.

item.title: Celtic to appeal against Trusty red card
item.description: Celtic will contest the decision to send off defender Auston Trusty in Sunday's 2-2 Scottish Premiership draw against Hearts at Tynecastle.

item.title: Musiala set for Bayern return six months after leg break
item.description: Jamal Musiala is set to return to the Bayern Munich squad seven months after suffering a leg break at the Club World Cup.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Man City 'got job done' - so is WSL title race over?
item.description: Manchester City capitalised on Chelsea's defeat to open up a nine-point lead at the top of the Women's Super League. Is the title race over?

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
